problem: Ms. Crabapple has a bag of jelly beans that she is going to divide equally among all of her 32 students who complete their homework every day over the course of a week. The bag has 384 jellybeans in it. Unfortunately, many of Ms. Crabappleâ€™s students have a poorly developed work ethic, and only half of them complete all of the required homework. How many jelly beans will each of the eligible students receive?
